chunks.zh: 在广州有车的前辈们，咨询个问题~~
chunks.en: To those senior members in Guangzhou who own cars, I have a question to ask~~

chunks.zh: 前辈们好，新年快乐！！
chunks.en: Hello seniors, Happy New Year!!

chunks.zh: 是这样，我想咨询一个停车费的问题。
chunks.en: I would like to ask a question about parking fees.

chunks.zh: [背景] ：
chunks.en: [Background] :

chunks.zh: 老婆摇中了油车牌，所以今年打算买第一辆油车了。
chunks.en: My wife won the lottery for a gasoline car license plate, so we plan to buy our first gasoline car this year.

chunks.zh: 但我们都还没买房子（近 2 年也不打算买房），所以需要在租房的这边弄一个停车位。
chunks.en: But we haven't bought a house yet (and don't plan to in the next 2 years), so we need to find a parking space near our rented apartment.

chunks.zh: [问题] ：
chunks.en: [Question] :

chunks.zh: 广州的停车位太贵了，据我了解，月保基本都要 1000~1500 左右，相当于无形支出又要多 1000 多。
chunks.en: Parking spaces in Guangzhou are too expensive. From what I understand, monthly parking passes generally cost around 1000~1500, which means another 1000+ in invisible expenses.

chunks.zh: 我想问问前辈们停车位费用的问题都是怎么解决的呢？
chunks.en: I would like to ask the seniors how they solve the problem of parking fees?

chunks.zh: 这个问题的最终解决方案是不是就是得买停车位呢？
chunks.en: Is the ultimate solution to this problem to buy a停车位 parking space?

chunks.zh: 无解。加钱可达。
chunks.en: No solution. You can achieve it by spending more money.

chunks.zh: 但是买停车位的人不多，大部分都是租。
chunks.en: But not many people buy parking spaces; most people rent.

chunks.zh: 1000-1500 的月保还是不多的，可能你住在高档豪宅社区吧。
chunks.en: 1000-1500 for a monthly pass is still not that much. Maybe you live in a high-end luxury residential community.

chunks.zh: @Takizawa 恰恰相反，我住在一个比较老的小区，小区最高楼层 5 楼，哈哈
chunks.en: @Takizawa On the contrary, I live in a relatively old residential area, with the highest building being only 5 floors, haha.

chunks.zh: @Takizawa 哥你月保多少  在哪个区
chunks.en: @Takizawa Bro, how much is your monthly parking pass? Which district are you in?

chunks.zh: 最优解就是租，市区就是这个价，1500 租金的车位买下来四五十万，而且不只是家里租金贵，公司那头一样贵，商场停车也贵，预算再加点。
chunks.en: The best solution is to rent. That's the price in the city center. Buying a parking space that costs 1500 to rent would cost you 400-500k. And it's not just expensive at home, it's the same at the company, and parking at shopping malls is also expensive. Add a bit more to your budget.

chunks.zh: 找找附近的商场办公楼，夜间没车的，比如体育西的天河城我记得夜间停车包月也就几百。
chunks.en: Look for nearby shopping malls and office buildings that don't have cars at night. For example, I remember that the Tianhe City in Tiyu West only costs a few hundred for a monthly nighttime parking pass.

chunks.zh: @WhoCanBeRich 天河区，我在单位，一年 300😂
chunks.en: @WhoCanBeRich Tianhe District, I'm at my workplace, 300 per year 😂

chunks.zh: 你住在哪里？我这番禺市桥月保 400
chunks.en: Where do you live? My monthly parking pass in Shiqiao, Panyu is 400.
1. Parking space fee 6000+/year
2. Insurance 4000+/year
3. Maintenance 1000+/year
4. Gasoline car 9L/100km, 64 yuan/100km

chunks.zh: 身边买油车的都后悔了，包括我，已经准备换纯电车，2 年多
chunks.en: Those around me who bought gasoline cars have all regretted it, including me. I'm already planning to switch to a pure electric car, after 2+ years.

chunks.zh: 月保 1000 以上基本属于市区中心区域了。
chunks.en: A monthly parking pass of 1000+ is basically in the downtown area.

chunks.zh: 车不是刚需，车牌建议放弃。
chunks.en: A car is not a necessity. I suggest giving up the license plate.

chunks.zh: 广州摇中了指标，可以延期，总共好像是一年半还是一年？ 不急。
chunks.en: If you win the lottery for a license plate in Guangzhou, you can postpone it. I think it's a year and a half or a year in total? No rush.

chunks.zh: 用车多么？
chunks.en: How often do you use the car?

chunks.zh: 如果很少，或者基本不用车，而你又在老四区里居住，放弃指标吧，买了也是累赘。
chunks.en: If you rarely use the car, or basically don't use it at all, and you live in the old four districts, give up the license plate. It's a burden if you buy one.

chunks.zh: 如果有小孩，2 ，3 年内家庭车是必须，目前又不想花大钱，可以考虑一下买一台 7 ，8 千块钱，车龄 10 几年，但又还能跑的车，养着车牌指标，一年一审手续全给黄牛去搞，2 个星期去发动一次，换新车时可以报废或者卖 2 ，3 千块钱。
chunks.en: If you have children, a family car is a must in 2-3 years. If you don't want to spend a lot of money right now, you can consider buying a car that costs 7-8k, is 10+ years old, but can still run. Maintain the license plate by getting the annual inspection done by a scalper. Start the car every two weeks. When you change to a new car, you can scrap it or sell it for 2-3k.

chunks.zh: 车放去郊区停车场。
chunks.en: Park the car in a suburban parking lot.

chunks.zh: 如果以上你也觉得白花钱，放弃指标，要车的时候再拍牌吧。
chunks.en: If you think the above is also a waste of money, give up the license plate and bid for one when you need a car.

chunks.zh: 丑话说在这里，开四停四虽然停了，搞成早晚高峰限，广州市区环内，迟早搞更深一层的机动车限行，限号的，太堵了。
chunks.en: Let me be blunt here. Although the four-days-driving-four-days-stopping policy is gone, they've implemented rush hour restrictions. Sooner or later, Guangzhou will implement deeper restrictions and license plate restrictions within the city ring. It's too congested.

chunks.zh: 除了 7 座（带电池的贵）建议买电车，混、纯电都可以。
chunks.en: Except for 7-seaters (which are expensive with batteries), I suggest buying an electric car, either hybrid or pure electric.

chunks.zh: 月保费具体你要说在那里。
chunks.en: You need to specify where you are referring for the monthly pass fee.

chunks.zh: 停车费无解，也不建议为了省停车费而折腾停车，算上买车养车平均一个月三四千少不了，衡量一下买车后是否能带来相应的生活质量提升再决定，车是纯粹的消费品
chunks.en: There is no solution to parking fees, and I also don't recommend trying to save on parking fees by fiddling with parking. Including buying and maintaining the car, it will cost you at least three to four thousand a month on average. Evaluate whether buying a car can bring a corresponding improvement in the quality of life before deciding. A car is purely a consumer product.

chunks.zh: 买个车，把车租出去，这样就不用停车位了
chunks.en: Buy a car and rent it out, so you don't need a parking space.

chunks.zh: @Takizawa #6 现在单位都这么豪横了么？进单位打工还要收停车费？
chunks.en: @Takizawa #6 Are workplaces so extravagant now? Do you have to pay for parking to work there?

chunks.zh: 停车费这个是必须的。
chunks.en: Parking fees are a must.

chunks.zh: 要不用车的时候，到处找车终究还是麻烦。
chunks.en: Otherwise, it's a hassle to look for a car everywhere when you need to use it.

chunks.zh: 不过正常的月保这么贵也不多。
chunks.en: But a normal monthly pass isn't usually this expensive.

chunks.zh: 找找附近的停车场？
chunks.en: Look for nearby parking lots?

chunks.zh: 不过这样就麻烦了，尤其是下雨或者炎热的天气，跑到车上一身水或者一身汗，所以加点小钱提升幸福感吧。
chunks.en: But that's troublesome, especially in rainy or hot weather. You'll get soaked or sweaty running to the car. So spend a little extra money to improve your happiness.

chunks.zh: @pppguest3962 #12 这个还没实行吧。
chunks.en: @pppguest3962 #12 This hasn't been implemented yet, right?

chunks.zh: 感觉实行不起来，毕竟周边城市太多，广州作为省会城市，还是要考虑周边城市的出行需求的。
chunks.en: I feel like it can't be implemented. After all, there are too many surrounding cities. As the capital of the province, Guangzhou still needs to consider the travel needs of surrounding cities.

chunks.zh: @canyue7897 #18 嗯嗯，太堵了，天河和珠江新城，过江桥，内环西，感觉早高峰限制没作用的，改善的唯一应该只能是加限制药量。
chunks.en: @canyue7897 #18 Yes, yes, it's too congested. Tianhe and Zhujiang New Town, the overpass, the Inner Ring Road West, feel like the rush hour restrictions aren't working. The only way to improve it might be to increase the restriction dosage.

chunks.zh: 话说，早高峰限这种玩法，已经 block 了中山佛山清远江门这些地方的居民，当天自驾进省会的大医院看病，逼人提前一晚到达广州住店过夜。。
chunks.en: Speaking of which, this rush hour restriction has blocked residents of Zhongshan, Foshan, Qingyuan, and Jiangmen from driving to major hospitals in the provincial capital for treatment on the same day, forcing people to arrive in Guangzhou the night before to stay in a hotel.

chunks.zh: @canyue7897 不一样。。我们是单位不是公司，平时住也在里面。
chunks.en: @canyue7897 It's different... we are a work unit not a company, we usually live inside as well.
